borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>Overall, the proposed development, by reason of its mass and proximity to the boundary lines would cause overshadowing and overlooking to surrounding properties. The proposal is therefore considered contrary to the following policies:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (2021);</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</p><p>- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</p>

<p>The proposed development, by reason of mass and sitting is considered an over-development of the site, and would not have regard to the established local character of the estate, which retains its original form and appearance. This is contrary to the following policies:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);</p><p>- Policies D4 and D8 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p>
description: Construction of a two storey side extension and construction of a rear dormer extension including two roof lights to the front.
